update_every.title: Update every
update_every.description: Data collection interval, measured in seconds.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: The timeout, in seconds, for connecting and querying systemd's D-Bus endpoint.

skip_transient.title: Skip transient units
skip_transient.description: If set, skip data collection for systemd transient units.

include.title: Include
include.description: Configuration for monitoring specific systemd units. Include systemd units whose names match any of the specified [patterns](https://golang.org/pkg/path/filepath/#Match).

collect_unit_files.title: Collect unit files
collect_unit_files.description: If set, collect the state of installed unit files. **Enabling this may increase system overhead**, particularly if the pattern matches a large number of unit files.

collect_unit_files_every.title: Unit files polling interval
collect_unit_files_every.description: Interval for querying systemd about unit files and their enablement state, measured in seconds. Data is cached for this interval to reduce system overhead.

include_unit_files.title: Include unit files
include_unit_files.description: Configuration for monitoring specific systemd unit files. Include systemd unit files whose names match any of the specified [patterns](https://golang.org/pkg/path/filepath/#Match).

timeout.ui:help: Accepts decimals for precise control (e.g., type 1.5 for 1.5 seconds).

skip_transient.ui:help: A systemd transient unit is a temporary unit created on-the-fly, typically used for ad-hoc tasks or testing purposes. They are created using the `systemd-run` command, which allows you to specify unit properties directly on the command line.
